data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word مُتَّكِئِينَ comes from the root و ك ا and is associated with the meanings: to recline.

data.meanings: veiled/concealed/covered/hid/protected (e.g. cloth, armour, grave, shield), invisible, become dark/posessed, darkness of night, bereft of reason, mad/insane/unsound in mind/intellect, confusedness.Become thick/full-grown/blossom, herbage, garden.Spiritual beings that conceal themselves from the senses (including angels), become weak and abject, greater part of mankind, devil/demon, people who are peerless having no match or equal, a being who is highly potent, sometimes refers to Kings because they are concealed from the common folk
data.sentence: The word الْجَنَّتَيْنِ comes from the root ج ن ن and is associated with the meanings: veiled/concealed/covered/hid/protected (e.g. cloth, armour, grave, shield), invisible, become dark/posessed, darkness of night, bereft of reason, mad/insane/unsound in mind/intellect, confusedness.Become thick/full-grown/blossom, herbage, garden.Spiritual beings that conceal themselves from the senses (including angels), become weak and abject, greater part of mankind, devil/demon, people who are peerless having no match or equal, a being who is highly potent, sometimes refers to Kings because they are concealed from the common folk

data.meanings: to spread out, extend, stretch forth, furnish. furshan - to low (carry burden), be thrown down (for slaughter) of small animals of which flesh is used for food. farashun (gen. n.) moths. firashun (plu. furushun) - carpet, thing that is spread out to lie upon, bed. Wife/spouse (metaphorically).
data.sentence: The word فُرُشٍ comes from the root ف ر ش and is associated with the meanings: to spread out, extend, stretch forth, furnish. furshan - to low (carry burden), be thrown down (for slaughter) of small animals of which flesh is used for food. farashun (gen. n.) moths. firashun (plu. furushun) - carpet, thing that is spread out to lie upon, bed. Wife/spouse (metaphorically).

data.meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.
data.sentence: The word دَانٍ comes from the root د ن و and is associated with the meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.
